area_name: Kearsarge Dome aka The Battle Ship

content.description: Fun little Patina climb on the little plug Far East Side.

Solid little patina face climb next to a wide crack. Two bolts on top of climb for TR set-up.

Name of this route is unknown as I don't have a guide book.
content.protection: Two bolt anchor for TR at top.
content.location: Climbers right of the detached "Northern Guillotine" flake.

content.protection:
6 bolts!

Same 2 bolt anchor as EP!
content.location: Located right side of east face! 30’ right of EP!!

content.description: Splitter hands to fingers to jugs to cups! If you are under 5.5 the crux might be the start but in general is pretty sustained.
content.location: Splitter little line just to the left of NG.

content.description: Good little finger crack to a bit of face.
content.protection: Finger size camera 2-3” piece for the top out.

content.description: Obvious worn run out slab to off width.
content.location: Start at the toe of the south side of the formation and climb the blocky ledges to the easy run out slab above. Staying to the right side winding back left to gain the off width above. A lot better than it looks an pro does appear in the form of some horizontals.

content.description: Nice clean short right facing corner with a finger crack, hiding in a cleft on the north upper side of this formation.
content.location:
Find EP and scramble through tunnel/cave to your right (north). Follow 4th class chimney up and left before popping out other side of cave system and route is located at the top of chimney on your left side.

Route does top out on formation.

content.description: Climb the large detached Guillotine flake, either chimney on the inside before the face transition or lie back the outside of the flake. (Harder to protect).
content.protection: Cams to 5." Thread a sling through suspect jug to pull crux and fire last bit of face! Bolted anchor.
content.location: Obvious detached flake on the western most side of mound which makes up the first corridor.

content.description:
Hopscotch is a classic 5.6 R rated scramble/tower traverse that leads you to a series of Czech style tower jumps!

The Czech’s would not be all that impressed but still fun.
content.location: Start at north east side of formation. Scramble up the narrow fin leading to the series of small towers that make up The Northern Guillotine and Choss Boss Routes. Some protection can be found for the series of jumps leading you to the anchors for NG and SCB.

content.description:
After a couple straight forward moves she gets punchy a couple of times. Think its obvious from the ground were this will happen.

This line was an invisionment of mine for many of moons before it came to life!

Hope you enjoy!
content.location: Located in the first corridor on the east side of the formation. Climb the grey streak to the black roof.

content.description: Ok Choss crack worth throwing some jams in but gross compared to it close nieghbor!
content.location: Wavering hand and cups crack 4’ to the left of SCB!

content.description: Great patina climbing up the impeccable brown face.
content.protection:
Scramble up first section of TSWRA  past first slab crux. Build gear anchor in horizontal crack to your right with

3-4”pieces.
content.location:
As of now TR only.

Starts 50’ to the right of the southern most toe of formation 20’ left of EP.

pathTokens: Kearsarge Dome aka The Battle Ship
